page.title: 04Traffic through Kingsley
page.content: The main road through Kingsley is very busy. It is called the A52 and it goes from Hanley to Ashbourne. It used to be one of the roughest roads in Britain until a couple of months ago when a new one was laid down. It has no Pelican crossing and is therefore very dangerous for pedestrians. New street lamps were put in so that it would be easier for people to see where they were going at night. There are a lot of heavy vehicles which carry sand and limestone from Cauldon Low quarries. Every morning wagons go thundering past, especially Tideswell's and Tarmac. Kingsley has no traffic lights which mean drivers have to be careful. In summer time the road is used by a lot of people who are going to Alton Towers pleasure park.
